name: 賴冠廷
objective: This course mainly introduces the latest AI technologies and applications, as well as how to use mainstream deep learning frameworks: TensorFlow & PyTorch. Students taking this course must possess good programming skills. Meanwhile, we will also introduce some fundamental AI algorithms.
schedule:
1.	Brief history of AI
2.	Machine Learning: How to make machine learn?
3.	Linear Algebra and Probability
4.	Gradient and Optimization
5.	Supervised Learning: Classification and Regression
6.	Unsupervised Learning: Clustering and Dimension Reduction
7.	Deep Learning and Neural Networks
8.	Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs)
9.	Midterm exam
10.	Natural Language Processing (NLP), Word Embedding, Self-supervised Learning
11.	Recurrent Neural Networks (RNNs) & Long Short-term Memory (LSTM)
12.	Attention is all you need! Transformer, Foundation Models and ChatGPT
13.	Object Detection and Segmentation
14.	Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs)
15.	Diffusion is all you need? Stable diffusion, midjourney, DALL-E 
16.	Deep Reinforcement Learning
17.	Final project demo
18.	Final exam
scorePolicy:
Kaggle homeworks (40%)
Midter and final exam (30%)
Final project (20%)
Quizzes and attendance (10%)
materials:
Francois Chollet, “Deep Learning with Python, 2nd edition” Manning, 2021
Latest pulibcations on NeurPS, AAAI, CVPR, ArXiv, Blogs, open source projects, etc.
課程對應SDGs指標: SDG1：消除貧窮（No Poverty）SDG3：良好健康和福祉（Good Health and Well-being）SDG4：優質教育（Quality Education）SDG8：尊嚴就業與經濟發展（Decent Work and Economic Growth）SDG10：減少不平等（Reduced Inequalities）
